info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 29 at 5:52PM EDT until October 01 at 9:12PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwestern Connecticut, including the following area: Litchfield County * WHEN...Through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - * Long duration of moderate to heavy rainfall continues this evening into early Saturday morning with total rainfall of 2 to 5 inches forecast. Greatest amounts are expected to be across southern Litchfield County. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
